2 Fundamentals: Company Creation This chapter explains the basic steps for creating and maintaining a company in Tally Prime, including company details, statutory information (GST, TDS, TCS), and account management. 2.1 Creating a Company 2.1.1 Steps Open Tally Prime. From the Gateway of Tally, select Create Company. Enter the following details carefully: Field Description Directory Folder path where company data will be stored. Name Legal name of the company (e.g., ABC Traders Pvt. Ltd.). Mailing Name Can be same as the company name or a trade name. Address Full postal address. Country and State Choose correct location for GST and statutory compliance. Pincode Optional but recommended. Telephone / Mobile / Email / Website Contact details for invoices and reports. 2.1.2 Example Name: RK Enterprises Mailing Name: RK Enterprises Address: No. 12, Main Road, Chennai – 600001 Country: India State: Tamil Nadu Email: info@rkenterprises.in 2.2 Company Features and Statutory Details After filling the basic company details, press F11 – Features or F3 – Statutory & Taxation to configure additional options. 2.3 Enable Statutory & Taxation Set the following options to Yes as applicable: Option Purpose Enable Goods & Services Tax (GST) For GST-registered businesses. Enable Tax Deducted at Source (TDS) If applicable under the Income Tax Act. Enable Tax Collected at Source (TCS) For applicable transactions. When prompted, enter GST details: Field Example Entry GSTIN 33ABCDE1234F1Z5 Applicable from 01-04-2024 Type of Registration Regular / Composition Assessee Type Individual / Company / Partnership 2.4 Currency Symbol Setup Tally automatically assigns the ₹ (Rupee symbol) for Indian companies. To change or view the currency symbol: Go to Gateway of Tally → Accounts Info → Currencies → Alter Edit the currency symbol or name as required. Example: $ for USD, £ for GBP. 2.5 Maintaining Accounts In the Company Creation screen: Maintain Accounts Only → For non-inventory businesses. Maintain Accounts with Inventory → For businesses dealing with goods or stock. Select the appropriate option based on business needs. 2.6 Selection, Closure, and Alteration of Company 2.6.1 Selecting a Company From the Gateway of Tally, select Select Company. Choose the desired company name from the list. 2.6.2 Altering Company Information From the Company Info screen, select Alter. Modify details such as address, email, or GSTIN. Press Ctrl + A to save. 2.6.3 Closing a Company Press Alt + F1 (Shut Company) to close the current company. The system will return to the Company Info menu. 2.7 Backup and Security (Recommended) Backup: Go to Alt + F3 → Backup, choose the destination drive, and confirm. Restore: Use Alt + F3 → Restore when required. Security Control: Enable user-level access under F11 → Security Control. 2.8 Summary Operation Key Shortcut Purpose Create Company Alt + F3 Begin new company setup Select Company Alt + F1 Open existing company Alter Company Alt + F3 → Alter Modify details Shut Company Alt + F1 Close company Backup Alt + F3 → Backup Save data copy  Tip: Always verify company information after creation and before entering vouchers to ensure accuracy in GST and financial reporting.

3 Chart of Accounts: Groups & Ledgers 3.1 This chapter explains the structure of the Chart of Accounts in Tally Prime, and gives step-by-step procedures to create Primary Groups, Sub-Groups, and Ledgers (single and bulk). 3.2 Overview — Concepts Group of Accounts: A way to classify ledgers. Groups can be Primary (root) groups or Sub-groups. Primary Group: e.g., Capital Account, Current Assets, Current Liabilities, Direct Expenses. Sub-Group: Group under a primary group, e.g., Sundry Creditors under Current Liabilities. Ledger: Individual account (e.g., Cash, Bank of India, Rent Expense) that belongs to a group. 3.3 Typical Group hierarchy (example) Level Example Primary Group Current Assets Sub-Group Bank Accounts Ledger Bank of India - Current A/c 3.3.1 Creating a Primary Group (Step-by-step) Open Tally Prime and go to Gateway of Tally. Select Accounts Info. → Groups → Create. In Name, type the group name, e.g., Bank Accounts. In Under, choose the parent group (for a primary top-level choose a suitable primary group, e.g., Current Assets). If required, set Maintain balances bill-by-bill or other group-specific features. Press Ctrl + A to accept and save. Example Name: Bank Accounts Under: Current Assets Accept → Group saved. 3.3.2 Creating a Sub-Group Follow the same steps as Primary Group creation, but choose a different Under value. Example Name: Cash at Branch Under: Bank Accounts (the sub-group’s parent) Accept → Sub-group saved. 3.3.3 Creating a Single Ledger (Step-by-step) Gateway of Tally → Accounts Info. → Ledgers → Create. In Name, enter ledger name (e.g., Cash in Hand - Chennai). Under → choose the appropriate Group (e.g., Cash-in-Hand or Bank Accounts). Enter Opening Balance if required (e.g., Dr 10,000). Provide other fields as needed: Inventory values are affected: Yes/No Mailing details (address, GSTIN) — if required for statutory ledgers Press Ctrl + A to save. Example Name: Cash in Hand - Chennai Under: Cash-in-Hand (Primary Group: Current Assets) Opening Balance: Dr 12,000 Save. 3.4 Alteration (Modify) of Groups and Ledgers 3.4.1 To Alter a Group Gateway of Tally → Accounts Info. → ’Groups → Alter` Choose the group to alter. Modify fields (Name / Under / other options). Press Ctrl + A to save. 3.4.2 To Alter a Ledger Gateway of Tally → Accounts Info. → ’Ledgers → Alter` Select the ledger. Change details (e.g., Group or Opening Balance). Press Ctrl + A to save. Note: Changing a ledger’s parent group affects reports. Always back up before major changes. 3.5 Deletion of Ledgers and Groups ⚠️ Warning: Deleting accounts with transactions can cause data issues. Use Alter → Set to Inactive where possible, or take a backup first. 3.5.1 To Delete a Ledger Gateway of Tally → Accounts Info. → ’Ledgers → Alter` Select the ledger. If allowed, press Alt + D (or choose Delete) and confirm. If transactions exist, Tally will block deletion. 3.5.2 To Delete a Group Gateway of Tally → Accounts Info. → ’Groups → Alter` Select the group. Press Alt + D to delete. Ensure all ledgers or child groups inside it are deleted or reassigned first. 3.6 Examples: Typical Ledgers and Groups 3.6.1 Example Chart for a Small Business Current Assets Cash-in-Hand Cash in Hand - Chennai (Ledger) Petty Cash (Ledger) Bank Accounts Bank of India - Current (Ledger) Current Liabilities Sundry Creditors (Ledger) Indirect Expenses Rent Expense (Ledger) Travel Expense (Ledger) Sales Accounts Sales (Ledger)
